str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.
Of Hebrew origin; Joannes, the name of four Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From apo and krino; to conclude for oneself, i.e. to respond; by Hebraism to begin to speak.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: Properly, to distinguish, i.e. Decide; by implication, to try, condemn, punish.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
From dike; equitable; by implication, innocent, holy.
Neuter of a compound of en and a derivative of optanomai; in the face of.
To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
More, rather. Neuter of the comparative of the same as malista; more) or rather.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
